p: Essential oils are a complex mixture of volatile and semi-volatile compounds, including monoterpenes, that can represent up to 90% of the oil, and sesquiterpenes as the main components [ 5]. Other minor constituents are esters, ketones, small phenols and alcohols [ 6, 7]. A number of studies report antioxidant, anti-inflammatory and antimicrobial properties of R. officinalis essential oil [ 8, 9, 10]. Furthermore, the strong influence of terpenes on the sensorial quality and shelf-life of several foods has been widely recognized [ 2].
